paragraphs.text:
%md ### Read dataset from csv file into a dataframe called 'df'
We will only use a small file with 10k entries for live demonstration

msg.data:
Read dataset from csv file into a dataframe called ‘df’

We will only use a small file with 10k entries for live demonstration

paragraphs.text:
val csvFile = "/Volumes/TranscendJetdriveLite330/htwg/master/sem4/seminar/scala-spark-mllib-demo/datasets/10k.csv"
var df = spark.read.option("header", "true").option("inferSchema", "true").csv(csvFile)

%md ### Rename column names
Columns of the original dataset contain spaces and dashes -> lets remove them

Rename column names

Columns of the original dataset contain spaces and dashes -> lets remove them

val newColumnNames = df.columns.map(_.replace(" ", "").replace("-", ""))
df = df.toDF(newColumnNames: _*)

paragraphs.text:
%md ### Drop some data
Some columns contain no values (null) -> lets drop them!

msg.data:
Drop some data

Some columns contain no values (null) -> lets drop them!

paragraphs.text: df = df.na.drop(Array("CallType", "Priority", "EntryDtTm"))

msg.data: df: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [CallNumber: int, UnitID: string ... 32 more fields]

paragraphs.text: %md ### Let's generate some more features

msg.data: Let’s generate some more features

paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.sql.functions._

df = df.withColumn("EntryDtTm", unix_timestamp($"EntryDtTm", "MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss a").cast("timestamp"))
df = df.withColumn("HourOfDay", hour($"EntryDtTm"))
df = df.withColumn("DayOfYear", dayofyear($"EntryDtTm"))
//df = df.withColumn("isWeekend", dayofweek($"EntryDtTm") >= 5)
df = df.withColumn("MonthOfYear", month($"EntryDtTm"))
df = df.withColumn("WeekOfYear", weekofyear($"EntryDtTm"))

Lets create our label column

paragraphs.text: %md ### Lets create our label column

val cfs = "CallFinalDisposition"

df = df.withColumn("label", when($"CallTypeGroup" === "Potentially Life-Threatening" && ($"$cfs" === "Code 2 Transport" || $"$cfs" === "Fire" || $"$cfs" === "Patient Declined Transport" || $"$cfs" === "Against Medical Advice" || $"$cfs" === "Medical Examiner" || $"HospitalDtTm".isNotNull || $"HospitalDtTm" =!= ""), 1).otherwise(0))

paragraphs.text: %md ### How many incidents are life-threatening?

msg.data: How many incidents are life-threatening?

paragraphs.text:
val potentiallyLifeThreatening = df.filter($"label" === 1).count()
val percentage = potentiallyLifeThreatening.toDouble / df.count()
println("%.2f%% of all incidents are potentially life-threatening".format(percentage * 100))

paragraphs.text: %md ### Convert categorical string values

msg.data: Convert categorical string values

paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.feature.StringIndexer

val categoricalFeatures = Array("CallType", "Priority", "NeighborhooodsAnalysisBoundaries")
val indexers = categoricalFeatures.map(cf => new StringIndexer().setInputCol(s"$cf").setOutputCol(s"${cf}Index"))

msg.data:

paragraphs.text: %md ### Define features & assemble into one column called 'features'

msg.data: Define features & assemble into one column called ‘features’

paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.feature.VectorAssembler

val featureNames = Array("HourOfDay", "DayOfYear") ++ indexers.map(_.getOutputCol)
val assembler = new VectorAssembler().setInputCols(featureNames).setOutputCol("features")

msg.data:

featureNames: Array[String] = Array(HourOfDay, DayOfYear, CallTypeIndex, PriorityIndex, NeighborhooodsAnalysisBoundariesIndex)

paragraphs.text: %md ### Prepare our pipeline stages

msg.data: Prepare our pipeline stages

paragraphs.text: val stages = indexers :+ assembler

println("numFeatures --> " + numFeatures)

paragraphs.text: %md ### Create a RandomForest classifier

msg.data: Create a RandomForest classifier

paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.Pipeline
import org.apache.spark.ml.PipelineStage
import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.RandomForestClassifier

val randomForest: PipelineStage = {

    val testPipe = new Pipeline().setStages(stages)
    val testModel = testPipe.fit(df)
    val testFrame = testModel.transform(df)
    
    //Find feature with max count for maxBins
    var max:Long = 0
    var count:Long = 0
    featureNames.foreach(feature => {
      count = testFrame.agg(countDistinct(feature).as("count")).collectAsList().get(0).getAs[Long](0)
        if (max < count) {
          max = count
        }
      })

    new RandomForestClassifier()
        .setImpurity("gini")
        .setMaxDepth(20)
        .setNumTrees(30)
        .setFeatureSubsetStrategy("auto")
        .setSeed(5043)
        .setMaxBins(max.toInt/*+10*/)
}

msg.data:
import org.apache.spark.ml.Pipeline
import org.apache.spark.ml.PipelineStage
import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.RandomForestClassifier
randomForest: org.apache.spark.ml.PipelineStage = rfc_69618b93f3fa

paragraphs.text: %md ### Create a MultiLayerPerceptron (MLP)

msg.data: Create a MultiLayerPerceptron (MLP)

paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.ml.Pipeline
import org.apache.spark.ml.PipelineStage
import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.MultilayerPerceptronClassifier

val mlp: PipelineStage = {
  val layers = Array[Int](numFeatures, 3, 2)
  new MultilayerPerceptronClassifier()
        .setLayers(layers)
        .setBlockSize(128)
        .setSeed(1234L)
        .setMaxIter(100)
}

msg.data:
import org.apache.spark.ml.Pipeline
import org.apache.spark.ml.PipelineStage
import org.apache.spark.ml.classification.MultilayerPerceptronClassifier
mlp: org.apache.spark.ml.PipelineStage = mlpc_e318f4c35f67

paragraphs.text: %md ### Now we can train a model

msg.data: Now we can train a model

paragraphs.text:
val classifier = randomForest
val pipeline = new Pipeline().setStages(stages :+ classifier)
val model = pipeline.fit(train)

//val timestamp = System.currentTimeMillis / 1000
//model.save(s"models/myclassifier-$timestamp")
%md ### Print Statistics

msg.data: Print Statistics

paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame
import org.apache.spark.mllib.evaluation.MulticlassMetrics

def printStatistics(what: String, result: DataFrame): Unit = {
    print(s"\n\n$what statistics:\n")
    val predictionAndLabels = result.select("prediction", "label")
    val metrics = new MulticlassMetrics(predictionAndLabels.as[(Double, Double)].rdd)
    val FPR = metrics.falsePositiveRate(0)
    val TPR = metrics.truePositiveRate(0)

    println(s"Accuracy: ${metrics.accuracy}")
    println(s"Confusion matrix: \n${metrics.confusionMatrix}")
    println(s"Precicion (How many selected items are relevant?): \n${metrics.precision(0)}")
    println(s"Recall (How many relevant items are selected?)): \n${metrics.recall(0)}")
    println(s"F-measure (best 1, worst 0): \n${metrics.fMeasure(0)}")
    println(s"Miss rate: \n${1-TPR}")
    println(s"False alarm rate: \n${FPR}")
}

val trainResult = model.transform(train)
printStatistics("Training", trainResult)

val testResult = model.transform(test)
printStatistics("Test", testResult)
